title: Does the Queen write her own speeches? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi. Great question. Quick answer = no. To prepare a quality speech that will be broadcast throughout the world requires hours of preparation. There are hundreds of reporters and journalists who would love to have a scoop - ‘”The Queen is wrong! She said this!” So everything she says as a public speech is vetted by several people before it is said or published. The Queen does not have time for all this preparation and checking and so she employs a speechwriter. The Queen can have input and final say, but the basic speech is prepared by someone else. Hope this helps, Paul

Please be precise when you ask questions. Quora is an international forum and you can’t assume everyone knows to which queen you are referring. The answer is yes and no. Like all heads of state, a speech will have inpout from a number of sources. But it will also depend on the subject matter and circumstance. Queen Elizabeth II’s recent address to the UK and The Commonwealth shows all the hallmarks of having been largely personally written. After all, this is someone with almost 70 decades of giving speeches and statesmanship and who is pareticularly well-informed.

No, she doesn’t. The Queen’s Speech at the State Opening of Parliament is written by the government. Speeches the Queen gives on state visits are likely to have been drafted by the relevant government departments too. Having said that, the Queen will have significant input into things like the Christmas address and speeches on non-political visits which will be drafted by her staff,

If you are refering to the Queen’s speeches at parliament, then definitely not. She is just given what to read. If you mean other speeches she may make, it is highly unlikely she writes them, but I presume she reads them first and makes changes or has some other role in the creative process.

Which Queen? United Kingdom, Spain, Denmark, Norway, Netherlands etc etc Elizabeth II and her private secretary, have input in her speeches. The opening of Parliament speech is written by the government.
Her Majesty's speeches are always a collaborative effort - between she and senior members of the Palace staff, and Her Private Secretary.

response.answer_text: Probably part of it then it would be fluffed. She’s been doing it for as long time so she’s an expert at it.
She’s given draft suggestions, which she may revise. The official Queen's Speech, which she reads at the State Opening of Parliament, outlining the schedule for new legislation - is presented to her.
